body.raw:
### What file types are supported? For now, PDF files are the only format supported. (Docx, RTF, Markdown, and more coming soon)

### Uploading Files (Before following these steps, [log in](https://studysail.com/sign-in) or [create a new account](https://studysail.com/sign-up)) {/* step 1 */}

First, [visit the "Add New" section of your dashboard](https://studysail.com/dashboard/add-new). {/* step 2 */}

To queue a file uploading to StudySail, drag and drop a file into the uploader box or click on the box to open your computer's file explorer. As mentioned above, PDF is the only file format currently supported (more coming soon). {/* step 3 */}

Finally, click the upload button and wait for the upload to complete. (Leaving the page before the upload is complete will cause the upload to fail) After the upload is complete you will be automatically redirected to your new StudySail document. {/* step 4 */}

After uploading, your file is safely stored in StudySail allowing your to use it to its full potential. If you have any questions, feel free to [send us a message](https://twitter.com/messages/compose?recipient_id=1679959524310958081).

body.raw:
_This guide assumes you have [generated flashcards](https://docs.studysail.com/generating-flashcards)._ In this guide we'll take the generated flashcards from a document on StudySail and import them as a new flashcard set on [Quizlet](https://quizlet.com). {/* step 1 */}

First, on a given flashcard page, click the quizlet button among the options in the top right corner above the list of flashcards.
This will automatically copy a Quizlet compatible formatted text blob. {/* step 2 */}

Next [begin to create a new set](https://quizlet.com/create-set). {/* step 3 */}

Next, click the import button: This should prompt you with a text box like this one: Leaving all of the settings in their default state, paste the format that you copied from StudySail: Finally, click the import button and then the create button to finalize your Quizlet set. {/* step 4 */}

You have successfully imported your StudySail flashcards into Quizlet. You can now utilize some of the awesome studying features that Quizlet has to offer!

body.raw:
{/* step 1 */}

In this guide we'll generate flashcards for our document "Sailboat Homework". First, navigate to this document's page in the dashboard via the navbar. The corresponding page should look like this: {/* step 2 */}

Next, navigate to this documents flashcards page via the blue arrow on the flashcards section. {/* step 3 */}

Next, select the "Generate" button in the top left corner of the flashcards page. You will then see a list of flashcards appear as each flashcard is generated. Here's a really slow gif example. {/* step 4 */}

You've successfully generated flashcards! Now, you can [study them](https://docs.studysail.com/studying-flashcards) or [use them on quizlet](https://docs.studysail.com/exporting-to-quizlet).
